titleInfo.title: Coll 5/32 ‘Air-route to India (Arab Coast): Possibility of establishing a landing ground on Das Island’

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between John Gilbert Laithwaite of the India Office, Harold Spencer Kerby of the Air Ministry, and Trenchard Craven William Fowle as the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. It documents the decision not to proceed with using Das Island as an emergency landing ground.The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
